entry.title: Millbrook - Potato Starch - 10 Kg
entry.summary:
Vendor: MillBrook
Type: FOOD
Price: 34.99

Details

This Millbrook gluten free potato starch will help you keep your pantry well-stocked with the essentials! Made from the starch of fresh potatoes, this dense powdery product is widely used for a variety of culinary applications. Potato starch is similar to corn starch and can be used as a replacement for corn starch in many recipes. It also has a higher heat tolerance than corn starch, making it perfect for thickening sauces, soups, and stews, in addition to puddings, pie fillings, and gravies. Use 4 tsp. of potato starch to substitute for every 1 Tbsp. of corn starch; when using it to thicken a liquid, mix the potato starch with a small amount of water to make a slurry before stirring it in to your recipe to help prevent clumping.Â 

Beyond thickening, potato starch also has numerous uses in baking. It helps add moistness to cakes, cookies, and other baked goods. It's also a key ingredient in shortbread recipes, where its fine texture produces crumbly and tender breads! Potato starch is also great for helping to produce a crispy texture in your sauteed or stir-fried meats and vegetables; coat small pieces of your desired ingredient in potato starch to produce a crispy coating. It's also the secret ingredient in the batter of extra-crispy deep fried foods! Add potato starch to the batter of your fried fish, onion rings, or any other food you want to fry up with a crispy, golden-brown coating. It's especially popular as an ingredient in crispy-yet-moist Japanese Karaage chicken. No matter how you use it, this potato starch is sure to be a key ingredient in your busy kitchen; this bulk 10 Kg supply will keep you well-stocked for all of your culinary needs!

entry.title: King Of Spice - Cream Of Tartar - 55 Lbs
entry.summary:
Vendor: King of Spice
Type: FOOD
Price: 209.99

Prepare perfect meringue, frosting, and other confections with this cream of tartar.

A must-have for your restaurant or bakery, cream of tartar produces creamy candies and sweet toppings that will keep your customers coming back for more. Cream of tartar is a dry, powdery, acidic by-product of the wine making process that is an essential element in a number of cooking and baking processes. Since it can keep sugar from binding together, it also prevents sugar crystals from forming on baked goods for a more attractive presentation and better consistency.

Bulk Size

Providing you with high volume at exceptionable value, this bulk pack cream of tartar will not only save you money, but will also save your staff time on re-ordering. Since a little goes a long way with cream of tartar, such as only needing 1/8 teaspoon per egg white when stabilizing, you can be sure this shelf-stable product will last in your pantry!

Use as a Stabilizing Agent

Cream of tartar is best known as a stabilizing agent for egg whites, this ingredient is essential for creating airy lemon meringue pies and fluffy angel food cakes.

Versatile Baking Ingredient

A staple pantry ingredient, just a little bit makes a big difference in a variety of baked good recipes. It can even be used to help protect color in boiled vegetables!

entry.title: Dawn - 175 Bloom Gelatin - 5 Kg
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dawn
Type: BAKING
Price: 129.99

Dawn - Gelatine 175 Bloom - 5 Kg -00830283

Unflavored gelatin is an odorless, tasteless and colorless thickening agent, which when dissolved in cold water, and heated and then cooled, forms a jelly. Certain fresh fruits contain enzymes that break down the gelatin, such as figs, pineapple, kiwi, papaya, mango, and guava.

The purest form of neutral gelatin available with a strong set. Use to make molds, aspics, fondants icing, chaud/froid (jelled white sauce to glaze hams, turkeys, etc.) and desserts.

entry.title: Ewald - Gelatine Gold Leaf Box - 1 Kg
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ewald
Type: BAKING
Price: 63.99

Ewald - Gelatine Gold Leaf Box - 1 Kg

The gelatin choice of chefs, leaf gelatin is easy to use and measure in the kitchen. This odorless, tasteless thickening agent forms a gel when combined with liquid and heat. Leaf gelatin melts more slowly than granular gelatin but produces a gel of greater clarity. Gold leaf gelatin sets firm (200 Bloom strength) and is ideal in the preparation of jellies, mousses, marshmallows, sweet or savory bavarois and aspics. This product is derived from beef and pork products.

entry.title: Dr Oetker - White Gelatine Sheets - 10 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dr Oetker
Type: BAKING
Price: 3.29

Dr Oetker - White Gelatine Sheets 6 Ct - 10 g

The purest form of neutral gelatin available with a strong set. Use to make molds, aspics, fondants icing, chaud/froid (jelled white sauce to glaze hams, turkeys, etc.) and desserts. Perfect to top and seal homemade pÃ¢tÃ©s. 6 gelatin sheets are sufficient for 2 cups (500ml) of liquid. Basic Directions: Soften the required number of gelatin sheets individually in cold water (about 5 minutes). Remove gelatin sheets from water, and drain. Following either the "hot" or "cold" preparation directions below.Â  Hot Preparation: Heat the liquid to be set. Add drained gelatin sheets. Stir unit gelatin sheets are dissolved. Cold Preparation: In a small saucepan, over low heat, gently stir gelatin sheets until completely dissolved. Fold into recipe, before gelatin begins to set. Chill recipe until set (about 2 hours). Tip: Fresh kiwi, pineapple, papaya and figs are not suitable for use with gelatin. Ingredient: pure gelatin

Type: BAKING
Price: 159.99

Parmalat - Skim Milk Powder - 25Â  Kg

Enhance your baked goodsÂ with added richness or create milk in-house to reduce waste and increase savings with this skim milk powder! This shelf-stable powdered milk can be used for a variety applications and is ideal for on-demand milk needs, as well as for cooking and baking.

Use in yeast bread, cookie, biscuits, and pancake recipesÂ to give your baked goods a tender, velvety texture and promote browning, as well as for creating thick, smooth, and creamy ice cream. It's also great as a thickening agent for yogurt, sauces, gravies, and soups to help elevate their richness, or for preparing bulk dry blends, such as signature hot chocolate mixes or pudding mixes.

entry.title: Grain Pro - Guar Gum - 500 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grain Pro
Type: BAKING
Price: 9.99

Grain Pro - Guar Gum - 500 g

Guar gum, also called guaran, is a galactomannan polysaccharide extracted from guar beans that has thickening and stabilizing properties useful in food, feed, and industrial applications. The guar seeds are mechanically dehusked, hydrated, milled and screened according to application

In foods and beverages, guar gum is used as a thickening, stabilizing, suspending, and binding agent.

entry.title: Grain Pro - Xanthan Gum - 1 Kg
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grain Pro
Type: BAKING
Price: 13.99

Grain Pro - Xanthan Gum - 1 Kg

Easily thicken sauces, gravies, and dressings with this xanthan gum!

Xanthum gum allows you to easily create allergen-free menu items for your guests. An extremely versatile addition to your operation, this all purpose thickening agent and stabilizer is great for making salad dressings, as well as thickening sauces and gravies. It is also an ideal plant-based alternative to gluten-free baking! Best of all, this product comes in such a packing, making it ideal for bakeries and restaurants with high-volume needs.

Versatile Ingredient

This xanthan gum will add high-rising volume and thickness to your gluten-free breads and baked goods to achieve a perfect, soft texture that is satisfying to allergen and non-allergen customers alike. You can even use it for adding substance to your low- or zero-fat dairy products, such as yogurt and ice cream. Plus, adding it to your signature ice cream, frozen yogurt, or sherbet will help prevent ice crystals from forming, allowing customers to enjoy the smooth creaminess of your sweet treats

Subtle Addition

Thanks to its white coloring, it will not alter the color of your recipes. Plus, since it doesn't add any additional flavors or odors, you can be confident that this xanthan gum will preserve the true flavor of your time-honored recipes.

Plant-Based

Xanthan gum is a non-hazardous additive that is made from the outer layer of a plant-based bacteria, xanthomonas campestris, during the fermentation process of carbohydrates. It then forms a solid and ground into a fine powder that can be added to liquids to form a gum!

entry.title: Unico - Cornmeal Yellow - 750 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Unico
Type: FOOD
Price: 2.99

Unico - Corn Meal Yellow - 750 g

Used for a variety of comfort food favorites, this cornmeal is a versatile ingredient for any kitchen!

This cornmeal is hearty and starchy, and is great for giving your baked goods an extra tasty crunch and adding texture to savory dishes. To produce the best product possible, the corn that goes into this cornmeal is picked by local farmers and then milled using techniques with superior attention to sanitation and food safety. When baking with cornmeal, it is important to note which grind size your recipe calls for, as each grind serves different culinary purposes.

Rightly Ground

This coarse ground cornmeal is perfect for making cornbread, corn muffins, hush puppies, as well as for breading. Great for breakfast and brunch menus, use to make grits or polenta; try adding minced garlic and grated Parmigiano Reggiano to your polenta for a savory foundation to your succulent meats!

Gluten-Free

Cornmeal is naturally free from gluten, making it a great option for making gluten-free, vegetarian, and vegan cooking.

Saves Prep Time

This bag of ground cornmeal offers easier handling and a smaller footprint compared to bulk bags of flour. Ready to use, this corn flour is an essential ingredient to keep on hand and with its ample supply, this product is sure to meet the needs of your high volume kitchen or bakery.

entry.title: Argo - Corn Starch Gluten Free - 454 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Argo
Type: BAKING
Price: 5.99

Argo - Corn Starch Yellow Gluten Free - 454 g

Stock up on corn starch for your kitchen with this economical Packing!

This must-have item is a staple in any restaurant's kitchen. Many people prefer to use corn starch as a thickening agent since it dissolves clearly, and doesn't alter the color or appearance of dishes. However, corn starch does clump when added to hot liquids or mixtures, and should therefore be added in small quantities.

Flavorless Thickener

A nearly flavorless thickener, it's great for thickening a variety of recipes, including gravies, sauces, pie fillings, and glazes. It can also be used to thicken custards, puddings, and other desserts! Corn starch has to be heated and cooked for a short period of time in order to lose its starchy taste. Heating it also brings out its thickening properties, making your dish just the right consistency.

Anti-Caking Agent

Besides being used as a thickener, corn starch is also an anti-caking agent when mixed with powdered sugar. It is often added to batters for coating chicken and other foods to help them fry to crispy and flaky perfection!
